p:
Of 8 Indonesian medicinal plants studied by Lohezic-Le Devehat et al.,
82 the methanolic extracts of Elytranthe tubaeflora and Melastoma malabathricum showed moderate anti-HSV-1 activity, defined by the authors as having SI values >4. On the other hand, the ethanolic and ethyl acetate extracts of Garcinia griffithii and the methanolic extracts of Elytranthe globosa, Elytranthe maingayi, and Piper aduncum showed modest anti-HSV-1 activity, having SI < 4. Neither methanolic extract of Vitex pubescens nor Scurrula ferruginea was active against HSV-1.
